title: Refund and Credits Guide 2.0
introduction:
We do refunds and credits for customers every day as agents and leads. There are many different scenarios that you will come across that need to be handled differently, depending on the situation. This guide will go over the different types of refunds you will do, how to handle each one, and best practices on what to do and what not to do.

Created by Alexandra Schmidt & Michelle Radowich

© For Credits and Refunds, US/PH/DR agents all have a limit of $50. Agents may now process the refunds and add the credits EVEN IF IT IS OVER THEIR LIMIT, 



EXCEPTION: Agents can refund passes Pre-Arrival no matter what the amount. (Unless it’s a Season Pass or the pass has cancellation restrictions)



@ Please be sure to ALWAYS confirm the name of the person you are speaking with and make sure that it matches the name on the pass. If the customer calling is NOT the account holder, we need to let them know we do need the account holder’s permission before we can process any refund or credit to their account, so they may need to call back.

Li) Remember, we do NOT price match when helping a customer to rebook. We do not give credit on top of a refund, unless the customer has had two or more Oversolds in the same day. If they have, then you may offer $5-$10 in credit for the frustration and inconvenience.

Remember that we should never offer the customer credit in circumstances like this. Let them ask for credit first.

© As of 09/11/24, we are no longer asking customers to provide proof of alternate parking in order to refund their parking pass. If they offer to send in a copy of their receipt or screenshot of their charge, that is fine.
While we can now refund parking passes for immediate refund needs, please be sure to do your due diligence and check the location to see if there are other passes cancelled for the same reason, if a customer has rebooked a new pass or try calling the location to confirm.
If a customer is requesting a refund for any reason over the phone, do your best to handle the case and refund if you are able to or get approval to refund if it is over your limit. Please be sure to direct them to https://go.parkwhiz.com/refund for all future refunds. If the customer has already filled out the form, please find the form and merge the tickets, then handle it right away.

There are a few exceptions to the refund policy and these passes fall under the Non-Refundable status:
- Passes with AXS as the MOR are Non-Refundable per AXS TOS
- Passes with SeatGeek as the MOR are Non-Refundable
- Passes bought on Stubhub are Non-Refundable per Stubhub’s TOS. (Usually these are reseller passes)
- Reseller passes are non-refundable even with proof (as of 09/23/24) The only exceptions are Seller Cancellations and Event Cancellations. We can refund reseller passes if a seller reaches out and requests it and/or if the event is cancelled.
o Reroute to a different location because the original cannot accommodate will also be considered a Seller Cancellation.
- Some sellers/locations have Special Refund Handling procedures (Such as Diamond Parking and locations that require approval by the NYC team) so be sure to double-check the location’s Admin page or reach out to the Lead on Duty if you get an error (red refund restriction) when trying to refund a pass in Admin (Special Refund Handling will be discussed later in this guide)

© We do NOT give a customera credit in lieu of a refund for any reason. If a customer is insisting,  as we may be able to make an exception depending on the situation.

© Refunds and Credits cannot be given if ithas been more than 14 days from the end date of the parking pass. Please reach out to the Lead on Duty if the customer has an issue with this and  to do a One Time Courtesy credit or tolerance refund.

EXCEPTION: Duplicate passes can be refunded even if its been more than 14 days from the end date of the parking pass. (Follow any Special Handling Instructions for the location)

© We are NOT able to refund any payment the customer made on-site since we can NOT refund money that was not paid to Parkwhiz. You can give the customer the phone number of the location and they would have to discuss that with them 

© For passes where a customer has used a promo code and we need to issue a one time courtesy (OTC) credit, you can credit the full base price since most promo codes can only be used once. If you aren’t sure how much credit to give, ask a lead in the Vortex.

sections.title: Pre-Arrival
sections.content:
Pre-arrival means before the start time, and they can be canceled up to one minute before the pass starts. Customers are able to cancel pre-arrival on their end through the App or Website, or they can call, email, or text us for help as well.

A Ifa pre-arrival request is backlogged and not worked on until post-start—CX late to process—the pass should be tolerance refunded. Do not use pre-arrival/other.
- This includes proof such as screenshots of an error that a customer might send.
- This also includes partner passes where ParkWhiz is not the MOR.
- For multi-day passes - issue tolerance refund in Admin, and manually debit the seller for the succeeding UNUSED DAYS FROM THE TIME THE BOOKING WAS REFUNDED.
o For example, if we were able to get to the request on the 3rd day from a 5-day booking, manually debit the seller starting day 3 to 5. (Add to the partial refund sheet w/seller debit)
In general, parking passes can be canceled pre-arrival; HOWEVER, it’s still a good habit to check the admin notes before doing that, as there are some exceptions. Agent and Lead refund limits DO NOT apply to Pre-arrival cancellations.

@ EXCEPTION: Reseller Passes (Marked as Non-Refundable in Admin) CANNOT be cancelled/refunded as Pre-Arrival
PLEASE NOTE: This seller has a FIRM NO REFUND POLICY and thus we should not process any refunds (their policy is stated in the Location Description and Parking Disclaimers fields). This applies to refund requests that are made after the cancellation cutoff (midnight day-of-event) / before arrival - and after arrival (post parking start time).
That said, please submit all refund requests to Brandon Flynn (bflynn@tampasportsauthority.com) and Ashley Greenfeld (agreenfeld@tampasportsauthority.com) so that TSA may take care of these customers in other ways.

Example of Admin note barring certain refunds
Limited Cancellation: Cancel this booking for free up to 10 hours before start time

Contact Us
888-472-7594

Example of cancellation policy verbiage on parking pass

sections.title: Oversold
sections.content:
- Try to call the location to verify if they are full. (If the location says that they were not full, we would not refund. Try to offer OTC credit if applicate or reach out to the lead on duty for help)
« Check if the customer has rebooked a new pass.
- Check if there have been other passes cancelled at the location for the same reason on the same date.

If you have checked all these, then you can go ahead and refund the parking pass as Oversold if it is under $50. If over $50,  Please let us know if you called and were able to speak with an attendant to confirm the location was full.

Li) Remember, we do NOT price match when helping a customer to rebook. We do not give credit on top of a refund, unless the customer has had two or more Oversolds in the same day. If they have, then you may offer $5-$10 in credit for the frustration and inconvenience.

Remember that we should never be offering customers credit in circumstances like this. Let the customer ask for credit.

Did the customer already rebook?
If so, and the new pass covers a similar timeframe, we can use this as proof and refund the ORIGINAL parking pass.

Are there similar reports?
Check the location in Admin to see if any other passes have been canceled by other agents or leads on the same date as the customer’s pass as Oversold.

Highlighted passes have been invalidated for some reason - you will still need to click through to confirm the reason, before assuming these are similar reports

vutner opuons Tor aocumentaton
Customers can send photo proof of the issue on-site, such as a full sign up or cones blocking the entrance, if they want to. If they do, we should still check that the photo matches the location, that there aren't alternate entrances, etc.

You can also attempt to call the location to confirm the issue. If you do this, please do it through Dialpad so that it is recorded. If the on-site attendant or location manager confirms that they were full, you can go ahead and refund the pass if it is under $50. If over $50, reach out for approval in the Vortex and let the lead know that you already called and confirmed the location was full.

sections.title: No Attendant
sections.content:
Some locations that we work with have attendants on site to validate a customer’s pass. These are usually valet locations and the validation method involves showing the pass to the attendant.

When an attendant should be there to take a customer’s pass but the customer says that there was no one when they arrived, there are a few things to verify before we refund the pass.

« Double check that the customer is at the correct location via the “How To Find It” section of their pass, using the pictures provided on the pass and even Google Maps if necessary.
- Ask the customer how long they have been waiting. Sometimes the attendant may be away helping another customer with their car or they may be on a break. Typically, if a customer has waited more than 15-20 mins and no attendant has shown up, then this would be eligible for a refund.
- Try calling the garage and see if you can get a hold of an attendant in case they may have stepped away for a moment. You can use the number provided in Admin or if there isn’t one available, try Googling for one. If the Point of Contact (POC) for the location has a phone number listed in Admin, you can also try calling them if you are unable to get hold of the location.
- See if the customer has rebooked a new pass or offer to help them find another location nearby that you can rebook them at while on the phone with them and once they have rebooked, the original pass can be refunded.
- If unable to verify with the location and no other passes have been refunded due to there being No Attendant, then you can refund without proof if it is under $50. If it is over $50, reach our for approval in the Vortex and let the lead know which steps you have taken to try and verify.

sections.title: Missing Amenity
sections.content:
Every location that we work with has different amenities that they provide for their customers. You can locate the amenities a location offers on their Admin page under the Pricing tab, at the bottom of the customer’s parking pass, and on the website by looking up the location’s details.

Examples of possible Amenity icons on parking passes - Example of Re-entry Allowed.
- Shuttle Service: This is usually found at locations that offer airport parking and have shuttles that take customers to the airport and pick them up at the airport.
- Tailgating Allowed: This means that the location allows customers to tailgate, which is to cook and/or have a small party in the parking lot, usually during sporting events.
- Unobstructed: This means that when the customer is parked they will not have any cars parked that block them in and prevent them from getting out.
- Attended: This means that there is an attendant on site usually to validate a customer’s parking pass.
- Handicap Accessible: This means that the location has handicap-accessible parking. We cannot guarantee customers a handicapped spot, as they are usually first come, first serve, so it is best to give the location’s phone number for the customer to reach out if they would like to find out more about the location’s handicapped parking.
« Indoor: This means that the location offers covered parking and protection from rain and snow.
- Printed Pass: This means that the location requires customers to have their parking pass printed out and usually displayed on their dashboard for validation.
- Re-entry Allowed: This means that the location allows customers to leave and return multiple times on the same pass.

Customers who book multi-day passes usually are looking for this amenity.

© If a location or pass does NOT explicitly show the Re-Entry amenity and mention that Re-entry is allowed on the customer’s_ pass or in the location’s Parkwhiz Detail page, then Re-entry is NOT offered. Customers can filter locations by Re-Entry in the Parkwhiz App on their smartphones but NOT on the website.
- Restrooms: This means there are on-site restrooms for customers to use.
- Security: This means that the location has security on-site keeping an eye on things.
- Valet: This means the location offers valet service, where they will park a customer's car for them and then bring it to them when they return to pick it up.
+ Vehicle Charging: This means that the location offers on-site charging stations for electric vehicles, such as Teslas.
If a customer arrives at a location and they booked it specifically because it showed that it offered a particular amenity, then when they arrive the location does not have it, then we can refund them as Amenity Missing but there are a few steps we have to follow first which are outlined below.

Examples of this would be: if a location offers Vehicle Charging but then says they do not have charging stations for electric vehicles or they are not working; if the customer booked at a location near an airport that offers shuttle service but they do not or their shuttle is out of service; or if the location says it allows tailgating then refuses to let a customer tailgate.
Before issuing a refund as Amenity Missing, please do the following steps:
- Escalate the missing amenity to the Digital Solutions Implementations team via a Freshdesk Ticket to implementations@parkwhiz.com (formerly the Merchandising Team)
« Once they have confirmed that the amenity is missing, then you may go ahead and refund the customer's pass as Amenity Missing. (Escalate to a lead if the pass amount is over $50)
- If there has been no response from the Digital Solutions Implementations Team within 3 business days, then please

sections.title: Poor Experience
sections.content:
Sometimes a customer will call in and let us know of an extremely bad experience they had at a location and they want a refund. We will usually refund a customer's pass when they have a particularly bad experience, though some of them may takea bit of investigation before we can issue the refund.

If an attendant is being very rude or abusive to a customer, we should escalate the situation to the location’s POC or NYC team for further investigation. If the customer left without parking, .
If a customer returns to pick up their car and finds it damaged or some of their items are missing, we want to remind the customer that ParkWhiz is not responsible for damage or theft since we do not own or operate the garages; however, we will do all we can to act as a mediator between the customer and the garage to help find a resolution. Agents should NOT refund for poor experience 

If we refund the customer's pass in the case of damage or theft claims, then we would be assuming liabilty which we do not want to do. We would want to give the customer the phone number for the location and/or emails listed in Admin that specifically pertain to damage and theft claims. Remember, DO NOT give out the POC’s email or phone number that shows in Admin.

© The customer must file a report with the garage for the damage or theft — which is best done before they leave the lot! -— and if they wish, they can also file a police report. We can send them an email through Freshdesk using the #damage-or-theft-claim canned response where the customer can reply with the paperwork they have.
- Sometimes a customer tells us that they have been waiting a long time to either enter a location to park or while trying to leave. Fifteen (15) minutes or more would usually be considered a long wait time. Sometimes it is understandable that attendants at locations may get busy or backed up a bit, so we would want to try calling the location to see if we can find out why there may be a long wait time. Again, we still need to document the issue and escalate to a Lead prior to proceeding.

o If acustomer has a complaint, BUT does end up parking - we should attempt to avoid a refund depending on the situation and perhaps offer some credit. A small credit such as $5 to $10 would be typical for most situations.

sections.title: Inaccurate Hours of Operation
sections.content:
Since the seller of each location that we work with sets up what hours are advertised on Parkwhiz, sometimes, there is some miscommunication and the hours don’t match up with what we have listed to what they have on-site.

When this occurs, some customers may book a pass for a time when the location isn’t open and they either can’t park or they are forced to leave early.
When this happens, we want to apologize for the issue, ask them a few questions, and take a few additional steps before we can issue a refund. If they couldn't park or chose not to park at the location, then you can try and help them find another place to park that can better accommodate the hours they need.

scenario, you will want to  and ask them to confirm with the seller what their hours are so we can see if this information needs to be changed on our end.
BEFORE issuing a refund as Inaccurate Hours, please do the following steps:
- Ask the customer if there is any sign or documentation of the hours for the location. If yes, please ask them to send a picture to help@parkwhiz.com or they can also send it via Chat.
- If there is no sign, please try calling the location to verify the hours that the customer told you with an attendant or manager.
- If the customer is no longer at the location, please create a ticket for DSS - Seller Support to verify the hours of the location.
- If Seller Support confirms that we have the wrong hours, then you can follow up with the customer and issue a refund of their parking pass. (Escalate to a Lead if pass value is over $50)
- 

© If the customer rebooked - you can go ahead with a refund; however, the issue should still be escalated to Seller Support

AUCNUANC KETUSeU VUSLOMEr
Sometimes when a customer gets to the location they booked, an attendant on site may refuse to let them park for a few different reasons. They may refuse to honor one of our passes, claim that they have no idea what Parkwhiz is, or the customer's vehicle may be too big to fit.
These are just a few examples of when an attendant on-site may refuse one of our customers, though keep in mind there may be other reasons as well.

When an attendant refuses to honor a Parkwhiz pass or says that the location does not work with Parkwhiz, send a ticket to the Digital Solutions Support - Seller Support at digitalsupport@parkwhiz.com so they can reach out to the seller to confirm.
If the customer claims that an attendant was very rude or abusive to them as well, then you would also want to escalate the behavior part to the appropriate POC or NYC tean, if the situation warrants it.
Before issuing a refund as Attendant Refused, please do the following steps:
- Make sure that the customer is at the correct location by utilizing the How To Find It Section of their parking pass as well as Google Maps.
» Check the bookings at the location for that day and see if there are other passes that have been refunded/canceled due to the attendant refusing to take the pass.
- Try to call the location and speak with an attendant or manager to confirm if they are refusing the customer and if so, why.
- If you are unable to verify with the location, check if the customer rebooked a new pass or help them rebook a new pass while they are on the phone with you. You can then refund the customer’s original parking pass.

@ If the customer says that they were refused due to an Oversize reason or because of the type of car they were driving, ask the MAKE AND MODEL of their car. We can Google the vehicle and find out the height and length. Check to see if there are any disclaimers for the location saying they do not take certain vehicles or if they have a height restriction. If they do and the customer’s vehicle falls under the disclaimer, we cannot refund though we can offer an OTC credit.

sections.title: Duplicate Passes
sections.content:
i Duplicate passes can be refunded even if it has been more than 14 days from the end date of the customer’s pass.
Note: The “Duplicate Booking” refund reason should be used solely for cases with a bug/system error. If it is a customer error, please use “Confirmed Rebook” instead.

Every now and then a customer ends up with more than one parking pass and they only need one. A customer may also call in because they saw they were charged twice (or multiple times) and they want to find out why.
To resolve these we need to verify that there is more than one pass for the exact same location, time, date, and/or event. To be considered a “duplicate,” the passes should also have been purchased within minutes of each other. If there is more than one pass that has all the same details, then we have established that there is some sort of duplication.

The next step is to determine whether the duplication is caused by tech/bug error or by user error. Based on this, the refund reason used in admin will change, so that instances can be tracked more effectively.
Tech/Bug Error
Refund Reason: Duplicate
User Error
Refund Reason: Confirmed Rebook
e Customer describes a technical issue
+ Repeatedly pressing the purchase
o Received an error message
button
+ There is a known issue/bug
+ Forgetting they purchased a pass, so they purchased again

Other things to check:
» Wrong email address
» Does the License Plate information
« Entered the wrong License Plate
match? Has it been changed?
¢ Under Tracking Data, does the Quote on each booking match?

Disposition: Tech/Network Issue > Tech _ Disposition: Account Assistance > Confirmed Rebook OR Customer error > duplicate passes

© Ifthe bookings were not purchased within minutes of each other, they may be better suited under Confirmed Rebook. Ask clarifying questions to understand how the “duplicate” was made - did they receive an error, use a bad email, etc.

Remember to check the dates on the passes. If they are both for upcoming events, then you can go ahead and refund one of them, just please be sure to verify with the customer which pass you are refunding and which one will still be active so they can be sure to use the correct one at their future event.

If the dates of the passes are for the same date and the customer is at the location already, then advise them to fill out the refund form once they have exited since it can be hard to Know which of the two passes the customer may have used, and we do not want to risk canceling the wrong one and then the customer will have trouble getting out after their event or have to pay on-site.

sections.title: Paid Again
sections.content:
There are times when our customers may have to pay on-site at the garage for one reason or another. Most often, this happens when there is an issue with their pass not scanning in or out, so they have to pay.

A Paid Again results in the customer paying again for the entire pass time-frame. It is not the same as paid additional (ie. early arrival, late departure, missing early bird, oversize/supersize).
It may also happen because:
- They arrived prior to their start time or exited after their end time, so they had to pay for that extra time at the garage’s on-site rates.
- They may be charged an oversize fee on-site by the attendant.
- Sometimes we just don’t know for sure why they may be charged and have to pay again on-site.

When this happens, we want to apologize that they had to pay on-site and try to ask them some questions to see if we can find out why.
- What time did they arrive and/or what time did they leave?
- What is the make and model of their vehicle?
- Did an attendant tell them why they were being charged extra?
- Did they violate re-entry? (This applies to multi-day passes only)
- Did they follow the validation instructions on their parking pass?
- Did they get an error message when trying to scan their pass and took a ticket to enter?
- How much did they pay on-site?

Whether you were able to verify why they were charged again or not, we are no longer able to ask them for a receipt or screenshot of the charge from a debit or credit card as proof of onsite payment. However, you should still ask how much they paid. We should also ask them a few questions to clarify the situation before we refund so we can determine if they paid onsite at the same location they booked or if they parked at the wrong location.
« Check that they parked at the correct location by going over the How to Find it section and reviewing the photos of the location on the parking pass or on the location’s Admin page.
- Verify that they want to the correct address or if they saw anything that said which seller the location was managed/operated by.
« Make sure that they didn’t just pay additional onsite for arriving early/staying late, for an Oversize Fee, violating an Early Bird arrival.
If you determine that the customer parked at the location they booked but still ended up having to pay onsite, then take them at their credit/debit card to verify.
If you determine that the customer parked at the wrong location and paid onsite, then we would treat this as an unused pass and do an OTC credit if they are eligible. Be sure to check their credit history and if the amount of the OTC credit is under $50, add it to their account. If it is over $50, reach out in the Vortex and .

© if they violated their time frame (Arrived early/stayed late/missed early bird) then we would NOT credit the difference, as it is their own error. Follow procedure for Paid Again or possibly OTC credit, and/or consult a Lead if needed.

@ When adding an OTC credit to a customer’s account for a parking pass, be sure to Invalidate the parking pass as Other Invalidating Pass - OTC, and uncheck all the boxes. Then send out the OTC email to them through FD.

sections.title: Closed
sections.content:
There are times when customers will get to the garage that they booked but they are legitimately closed or circumstances happen that are beyond anyone’s control and the customer is unable to park.
Some of the reasons that we would be able to refund a customer as Closed are:
- The location is legitimately closed. You can verity this by asking the customer why they think the garage is closed. This would usually be due to the gate being down, doors closed, lights off, no attendant around, etc
- Car elevator/lift is broken and the attendant on site is turning customers away.
- Location is flooded, filled with snow, etc and the location is unable to accept customers.
- Location cannot take customers because their payment system or internet may be down.

Before refunding as Closed, please do the following steps:
- Call the location to verify if they are closed or if there is an issue preventing the customer from parking such as those listed above.
- If the customer says the location is closed, please ask them to send a picture of the Closed sign or any other indications that show it is closed if they are still there and able to do so safely.
- Check the passes from that date at the location to see if any other passes were refunded for the same reason.
- Confirm that they are at the correct location.
« Check if the customer rebooked a new pass through Parkwhiz or if you are able to help them rebook.

If you were unable to confirm with the location, there are no other passes cancelled and the customer can’t safely send a photo, then you can go ahead and refund the pass as closed if it is under $50. If it is over $50, reach out for approval in the Vortex and let the lead know which steps you have done.

In any of these cases, once you have taken care of the customer, please be sure to send a ticket to Digital Solutions Support - Seller Support at digitalsupport@parkwhiz.com via Freshdesk, so they can reach out to the seller and verify the situation and see if the location needs to be paused or blacked out so customers can’t book.

sections.title: Accessibility
sections.content:
There will be times when a customer is unable to access a location due to no fault of their own, the seller’s or Parkwhiz simply because there is no way to access the garage.
Some reasons that a customer may be unable to get to the garage to park are:
- The road going to the garage or in front of the garage is closed for some reason, such as construction.
- The road is blocked off by police due to a parade or event that is going on or will be happening later that day.
- A location has an on-site emergency and they are unable to be accessed.

Before Refunding as an Accessibility issue, please do the following:
- Ask them to confirm which street is closed/blocked off and the reason such as construction, police have it blocked, an event is going on.
- Use Google Maps to see if you can help them get to the garage via an alternative route
- See if you can confirm the closed streets on Waze Live Map or Google Maps.
- Check the parking pass to see if the garage has a second entrance that the customer can use to enter and park.
- Try to call the garage to see if you can confirm the accessibility issue.
- Check the passes for that date at the location to see if there were any others cancelled due to the same accessibility issue.
- Check to see if the customer rebooked a new pass through Parkwhiz or help them rebook one.

If you are unable to confirm road closures or any accessibility issue with the above steps, you can refund the pass as an Accessibility Issue if it is under $50. If it is over $50, reach out in the Vortex for approval and let the lead know which steps you have taken to verify.
Also, please be sure to send a ticket to Digital Solutions Support - Seller Support at digitalsupport@parkwhiz.com via Freshdesk to alert them to the issue so they can reach out to the location to see if they need to pause or black them out while the issue is going on.

sections.title: Confirmed Rebook
sections.content:
We often get customers calling in that want to make changes to their parking pass for various reasons, such as...
- Booked the wrong time frame or location
« They would like to change their start time to an earlier one.
e They booked the wrong date.

Since we are unable to make changes to a pass once it is booked, the only solution is to have them rebook for the new time, date, or location they want.
Sometimes they call in prior to the start time of their pass and we can simply cancel it as Pre-Arrival once they have rebooked. If the parking pass has already started, we can refund only if they have rebooked with the same Seller. If we cannot do a legitimate confirmed rebook, we may be able to offer a credit based on their credit history.
If the customer has not rebooked yet, we can attempt to assist the customer in doing this by checking if the location has availability for the new time or dates the customer would like.

If they do, either you can rebook for them (IF the payment method is already saved to the account), or they can book on their own.
Once you have confirmed that they did rebook for the same location or at a different location that is operated by the same seller as the one originally booked, then you can refund the original parking pass as a Confirmed Rebook.

© We do not use “Pending Rebook.” Customer MUST complete a new booking prior to refunding original pass.

@ Reminder: For internal tracking purposes, “duplicate” passes caused by user error will be refunded under the Confirmed Rebook reason in admin. See the Duplicate Passes section for more details.

sections.title: ParkWhiz Cancellation/Seller Cancellation
sections.content:
There will be cases where a seller will reach out to Parkwhiz and ask us to cancel bookings made at their location/s because they are unable to accommodate them due to a change in operating hours, special events or there was an issue with the price offered for passes on the Parkwhiz website and/or app.
This is the one Refund reason that CX agents will never end up using because it will be the seller reaching out to Parkwhiz about canceling bookings and not a customer. When this happens, customers are sent an email about the cancellation, but they may call in to find out more about why their pass was canceled.

0 If you are trying to find out more about a Seller Cancellation, reach out to the Lead on Duty and we can escalate or try to get in touch with the agent that canceled the pass to see if we can find out more information for you to tell the customer.

Customers likely will be upset about Seller Cancellations so do your best to be empathetic while letting the customer know that it is beyond Parkwhiz’s control since we are a third party listing service for the locations and do not own and run them. If a seller contacts us and asks us to cancel/refund or rebook customers, then we have no choice but to do as they ask.
There are a few ways to tell if a pass was canceled at the request of the seller. In the screenshot below, you can see that it was canceled by Xel and the reason stated is “This booking was canceled at the request of the seller because it could not be accommodated”.

sections.title: Disclaimers
sections.content:
Some parking passes will have disclaimers on them for various things that a customer needs to be aware of both when booking and when getting to the garage. Some examples of disclaimers you will see on a parking pass are:
« Vehicle drop off and pick up times
- Vehicle size restrictions, such as maximum height.
- On-site oversize fees.
- Location unable to take certain types of cars such as Teslas.

In cases where there is a disclaimer on the pass and on the location information on the website when booking, and a customer violated this disclaimer, then they are_not eligible for a refund since they did not follow the instructions on their pass.
The reason for this is because it would not be fair of us to penalize the location for a customer's error. While we cannot refund them, we can give them a one time courtesy credit and help to educate and empower the customer on the disclaimers so that they are aware of them going forward when they book a pass next time.
You may need to doa little detective work with the customer to verify if they violated a disclaimer. Be sure to check the pass carefully for any disclaimers and depending on the issue, you will want to ask a few clarifying questions to determine if they violated a disclaimer or not.
- Ask them the make and model of their vehicle to see if it is considered an oversized vehicle or if it is larger than the maximum height restrictions. You may need to Google the type of vehicle in order to find the dimensions, then you can determine if it is bigger than the maximum height allowance or considered an oversized car.

@ An oversized vehicle is one that is at least 180 inches (15'1") long and/or 70 inches (5'10") high. Any vehicle that meets or exceeds these dimensions is subject to the oversized vehicle charge. If the charge isn't included in the booking price, then this fee is assessed and paid onsite.
Please refer to the What is an Oversize Vehicle? page of the Parkwhiz Knowledge Base for more information on Oversize and Supersize Vehicles. You can also provide the customer with this link over the phone or via email.
» Ask them what time they arrived and/or left the garage. You want to verify that they were within the time frame not only of their parking pass but also within the garage’s operating hours for pick-up times. Some locations offer overnight parking but theyare not open 24/7 so they will have a disclaimer stating that vehicles must be picked up between certain hours during the week or weekend.
- If a disclaimer discloses details such as height requirements, operating hours, etc that were simply overlooked, a one time courtesy credit is all we can do. The seller shouldn't be punished for something that is clearly indicated on the pass or in the location description before booking. If you are in doubt or the customer pushes back on the credit, please consult the Lead on duty.
Below you will see a couple of screenshots that show examples of disclaimers that you will see on several different locations.

sections.title: Tolerance Refunds
sections.content:
© Tolerance refunds should only be used as a last resort. Agents should NOT process tolerance refunds on their own, and instead should relay the situation to a Lead first.
What constitutes a reason to do a tolerance refund?
- Customer is a first-time user and is unfamiliar with our policies
o These should still be handled according to the procedures outlined in this guide and/or offering OTC credit FIRST
- Customer is refusing credit, being combative, etc.
o Again, please reach out to a Lead first
- Customer encountered an unavoidable system issue
e These issues usually have special handling instructions and should still be done by a Lead
Pre-arrival requests that were backlogged and not worked on until post-start

sections.title: Multi-Day Partial Refunds
sections.content:
Sometimes a customer encounters an issue on-site when attempting to park, fails to notice that a location does not allow re-entry, the re-entry amenity is promised but fails, or they leave early with time remaining on the pass. Provided that they have contacted us immediately, we may be able to issue a partial refund.

© . Partial Refunds should only be done by a Lead and should not be promised without consulting one.
o Partial refunds cannot be issued to Canadian customers; however, a coupon can be issued if needed.
- Acustomer must have already left the location for any consideration of a partial refund. If they have not left, they need to contact us after doing so (go.parkwhiz.com/refund or email help@parkwhiz.com). Do not advise them to leave early in order to gain one.
vy What if the customer contacts us after the pass has ended?

As of September 2024, we are no longer able to request receipts. It’s vital to ask questions and gather information to determine what happened and to ensure that we are being as accurate as possible without this information. If a customer reaches out after the pass has ended or claims they left earlier than the date of contact, we should do the following:
- Confirm that they went to the correct location
- Attempt to verify issues via similar reports
0 Some issues can be escalated to DSS (ex. location refused pass because it was overnight)
- If they violated re-entry:
o Was re-entry allowed? If it was, this should be escalated to DSImp (Implementations)
e Was an attendant at all able to assist them? Did they speak to one?
«= Sometimes, attendants will buzz people in and out. We want to determine at what point they were no longer able to use the pass.
o Did they have to pay on-site?
» If so, please ask how much they paid (similar to handling paid again/extra cases)
- If they were able to park, confirm actual entry and exit times using the pass

!! City Parking will typically not allow partial refunds that are due to violating re-entry (re-entry is not allowed and the pass would likely have been redeemed).
!! Special handling always supersedes - if a location requires approval, this is still required
Once we have gathered all necessary details, we can process according to the customer's word.

OA pass is considered “multi-day” ONLY if it is billing for over 24 hours.

© We can only process a partial refund if we are the MOR (Merchant of Record). We cannot process partial refunds for partner bookings such as Groupon. In these cases, they will need to contact the partner/site purchased from.
a Regardless of how soon a customer left after parking, we must always charge for the first 24 hours + buyer fee.

What documentation is required?
© Ifthe pass was purchased through Groupon, they will need to contact Groupon for assistance. We can NOT partially refund these.

On-site issues (oversold, attendant refused, etc) should be documented using the same procedures outlined in this guide. If they rebooked or there are other passes cancelled for the same reason, etc. reach out to a Lead to process.

If the customer parked but left with time remaining (violated re-entry, left early, etc) we must do the following:
- Confirm they have already left the location - the pass will be cancelled and if they have not left, this will cause an issue for them.
'Y If Yes, collect more specific information {arrival date/time and exit date/time) and forward to a Lead
vy What if the customer has not left the location?

If they have not left, please advise them to contact us once they have actually exited for review (do not promise any refund). We do not process anything based on a customer saying when they will exit.
vy What about flight cancellations?

Groupon customers need to be referred to Groupon. In all other cases, follow the steps noted above and process accordingly. We are no longer asking for proof of cancellation, receipts for parking elsewhere, etc. Reach out to a Lead with any questions.

What about On Demand Sessions?
- If it is a normal on-demand session, we may be able to process partial refunds. Escalate to a Lead first.
- If the pass becomes multi-day by using the extend option - extend is non-refundable in general.
o We may be able to offer a credit after following the procedures outlined above. In some rare cases, a partial refund may be possible; however, this would need approval.

What about cruise parking?
For cancellation of multi-day passes for any CRUISE parking, please direct the customer to the location for assistance. We can advise that contacting the location directly typically speeds up the process, as it allows the complaint to be communicated directly with the operator, who can then reach out to us with approval. You can provide the phone number in admin (DO NOT provide the POC’s email or phone number). You can also Google search the location to see if they have a contact form or email address.

A Please make it clear that refund requests must be handled by the location directly.

sections.title: Monthly Parking Refunds
sections.content:
Some locations have monthly parking through Parkwhiz. Usually customer’s purchase the first month through us and then any subsequent months are paid through the garage they booked. There are some exceptions to this. When it comes to refunds for monthly parking, it is handled a little differently as compared to daily or event parking.

Monthly passes can be cancelled as Pre-Arrival as long as the customer reaches out on the start date of the pass or before. Agents may cancel a monthly pass as Pre-Arrival (As long as its not after the start date) no matter the amount but if you do not feel comfortable doing it since some monthly passes can be several hundred dollars, reach out to the Lead on Duty and they can help you with this.

For all monthly passes where customers call looking for a refund and it is after the state date of the pass, then we have to escalate this and get approval for the refund first.
- For all monthly passes in New York, email nyc@parkwhiz.com for approval to refund a monthly pass after the start date. Please copy Hilda using hgutierrez@flashparking.com if needed for follow up.
- For all other monthly passes, email the Point of Contact (POC) at the email listed on Admin for approval to refund a monthly pass after the start date.
e For SOMA Hub-255 Garage please email nicholas.paasch@propark.com, jay-li.poon@propark.com, gabriel.iniguezlink@propark.com per the admin note.
O If you have emailed for approval to refund a monthly pass but have not heard back after 3-5 business days, please escalate to a Lead so that we can attempt to follow up and/or escalate to Management for how to proceed.

sections.title: Season Package Parking
sections.content:
Season Package parking are when a customer purchases parking for the either the half season or full season of a sports team’s home games. We work with several venues and teams to offer these packages for baseball, hockey, football, basketball, and soccer. We even have a few venues that offer season packages for Broadway shows.

© Season Package Parking are NON-REFUNDABLE. Customers are made aware of this upon purchase. There may be some exceptions made, but that would be done on a case by case basis and would need approval from Management or the Venue/Team possibly.

© @ REFUNDING PASSES DIRECTLY THROUGH ADMIN CAN CAUSE THE ENTIRE PACKAGE TO BE REFUNDED. FOLLOW THE PROCESS HERE @ Season Package Parking

© Individual passes in a Season Package can be refunded for any of the valid refund reasons, such as Oversold, Accessibility, Paid Again, as long as the claim is legitimate.

EXCEPTION: WE CAN’T CANCEL/REFUND INDIVIDUAL PASSES IN A SEASON PACKAGE AS PRE-ARRIVAL UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES.

sections.title: Refunding Duplicate Season Packages
sections.content:
One exception to refunding Season Packages is when a customer purchases a duplicate package. We can refund one of the packages but there are a couple of things to keep in mind when doing so.
- Each pass in the duplicate season package will have to refunded individually. We can’t simply refund the whole package. If you have a customer call in about a duplicate season package, please reach out to the Lead on Duty before refunding any part of the duplicate season package.
- Each season package has their own Transaction ID number and Package Purchase number. When refunding a duplicate season package, you have to make sure that you canceling all the passes in the same package.

© @ REFUNDING PASSES DIRECTLY THROUGH ADMIN CAN CAUSE THE ENTIRE PACKAGE TO BE REFUNDED. FOLLOW THE PROCESS HERE OR REACH OUT TO ALEAD: @ Season Package Parking

sections.title: Locations/Sellers with Special Handling for Refunds
sections.content:
There are several sellers/locations that have special ways they have asked ParkWhiz to handle refund requests. These special requirements can be found listed on the Location’s Admin page and/or there will be a restriction set up in Admin that shows as a Red Refund Restriction when an agent tries to cancel a parking pass.

Viamona rarKking

sub_sections.title: City Parking - Seller Admin Link - Locations
sub_sections.content:
IMPORTANT FOR Cx:
© 03.19.2024 (Per Lana: Please DO NOT send me emails if the customer was not paying for our garage. Please send me only if the customer paid you for the reservation and also paid in our garage. In this case, you should not return to them payment for the reservation till they send you confirmation that they not going to dispute with City Parking.| FD: 201061 & 196659) NO need for approval for oversold, accessibility, closed, etc.
¢ Reach out to Lana lana@cityparking.nyc for approval BEFORE processing any REFUNDS (aka cancellations after booking start time) ONLY IF the customer paid twice to City Parking and Parkwhiz. | FD: 186485 (2024.3.12)
¢ If acustomer asks for a refund from Parkwhiz, they must confirm in writing that they will NOT dispute the payment made onsite (City Parking), send a copy of this confirmation to Lana. | FD: 196904 (2024.3.15)

For all City Parking locations, we only need to get approval for Paid Again refunds. The customer must provide written confirmation that they will NOT dispute the payment made on site at any City Parking location. We can send them the canned response #City-ParkingDispute through Freshdesk and once they have replied, email Lana with a copy of the confirmation and the information on the parking pass.
lana@cityparking.nyc

Since we no longer can ask customers for receipts/screenshots of charges for paid again refunds, this means that when reaching out to Lana for approval for Paid Again refunds, you only need to have the customer send in written confirmation that they will NOT dispute the onsite payment made at the City Parking location.

If Lana (or any other sellers) still ask that we get a receipt from the customer, per Nona, You can tell them that “Our legal team has required us to stop asking customers for receipts." and if they still insist on one after you've told them this, then please escalate the issue to the Lead on Duty so we can let Nona know.

sub_sections.title: Olympia Development Parking - Seller Admin Link - Locations
sub_sections.content:
CX: All passes must be canceled 3 hours before booking start time as this location has a 3 hour cancellation restriction. FD 347875. -MD 7/8/24

All Olympia Development locations have a 3 hour cancellation cut-off (restriction). The restriction shows prior to purchase and on the parking pass - “Limited Cancellation: Cancel this booking for free up to 3 hours before start time.” This keeps the user from being able to cancel on their own. While CX/DSCS may still see the pre-arrival option within admin, we should still follow the restriction.

A. For example, if the pass begins at 10am, then between 7am-9:59am there is a cancellation restriction. Any contact/requests are no longer considered “pre-arrival” if they are received within the restriction window. Instead, we can educate the customer, invalidate the pass and offer OTC credit (where applicable).

Refund requests post-start and/or for issues on-site can be handled according to standard policy without further approvals (FD 367273).
FYI for Leads/Supervisors- if it’s necessary to contact, please reach out to the below recipients (FD 371526)
Corporate.parking@olympiaparking.com
Bambassema.badjo@olympiaparking.com
Jordon.rose@olympiaparking.com
Ajawon.williams@olympiaparking.com

sub_sections.title: SOMA Hub-255 Garage (Monthly Passes Only)
sub_sections.content: For refund or cancellation of monthly passes for SOMA Hub-255 Garage please email nicholas.paasch@propark.com, jaylLpoon@propark.com, gabriel.iniguezlink@propark.com per the admin note.

sections.title: On-Demand Bookings
sections.content:
On-demand sessions differ from Reservations in that the customer should be physically on-site and it begins immediately. On-demand refers to the following types of tickets/bookings: STP, DTC, OSL, BLE. In most cases, on-demand sessions cannot be initiated without being physically on-site (Park then Pay is an exception where session can be initiated in app; however, they should be on-site when doing this).

4. There are two situations with On Demand passes where we WOULD NOT/SHOULD NOT credit the customer or if we do, it would be minimal credit, such as $5. (In cases such as this, reach out to a Lead for help on how best to proceed)
1. If a customer calls in because they did an On Demand Pass that is several hours (such as an 8 hour pass and this was the lowest rate tier available at the location) but they say they only parked for a portion of the time (e.g. 15 minutes) and want a credit for the “unused time.”
2. If a customer calls in because they did an On Demand Pass and were able to park but when they got to the location/attraction they were going to and found out it was closed. If they call in asking for a credit due to this, we wouldn't do so since they were able to park.
Since on-demand sessions are initiated on-site, in general, they are non-refundable. The exceptions to this would possibly be Duplicate, Multi-day and Paid Again — follow the procedure outlined in those sections. If any other reasons come up, please escalate to a Lead.

sections.title: Extend / Multi-day with Extend
sections.content:
Extend rates are considered non-refundable given that they are user initiated. This includes passes that are multi-day with—-or due tothe customer extending the pass. We should NOT process a refund; though, we may possibly offer credit. 

Duplicate
At times and for various reasons, it’s possible for on-demand sessions to be duplicated. If we can confirm that this happened, we are able to refund the customer. Follow any Special Handling instructions as needed (ex. Diamond Parking). If there are any questions or doubts, consult a Lead.

A Be sure to ask whether the customer encountered an error message
- If the customer encountered an error message, be sure to use the following disposition: Tech/Network Issues — Tech error resulting in duplicate passes
o Use the Duplicate refund reason

To help determine whether the booking is duplicated, follow these steps:
- Follow the procedure outlined in Duplicate Passes
- Double check that the License Plate information is the same for all passes in question

Another tip to determine if a pass is a duplicate of another is to use the Find tool in your browser to compare the Quote IDs on the bookings. If they match, the passes are likely duplicates of each other.

If everything checks out, the duplicate passes can be refunded (or escalate to a Lead if the location has special handling). Based on the customer's description and our findings, use the Duplicate refund reason for tech errors and Confirmed Rebook if it’s user error.

sections.title: Paid Again
sections.content:
In general, users that have on-demand sessions shouldn't have to pay again on-site; however, there may be a few exceptions. Consult a Lead with any questions.
- Ifacustomer has a DTC ticket that is open and they are not able to complete payment in the app, they may be required to pay again on-site. If so, follow procedure for Paid Again situations (ask for the amount of the charge)
- If the customer has a DTC ticket and has overstayed the grace period, they may need to pay again on-site. Follow procedure to determine whether payment is actually for the entire time-frame or an additional fee - consult a Lead if needed.

sections.title: Cheaper On-Site/Rate Questions
sections.content:
In general, the rates for on-demand are maintained by the seller themselves and should be in line with the on-site rates at the location. If a customer has a question about the rate billed, claims that it is incorrect, etc. we can refer to them to the location for further inquiry. If needed, reach out to a Lead to see if the Seller can/should be contacted.
If the customer has proof of the discrepancy, we may be able to investigate further on a case by case basis.

sections.title: Special Cases / Exceptions
sections.content:
There may be exceptions other than what is covered here. For example, a rare issue with Express Pay would be that the customer’s session does not close properly and causes them to be billed for multiple days—we should address/assist with this. Another exception/special case would be when a customer has to book again because the LP was entered incorrectly (Confirmed Rebook).
Please be sure to evaluate the case and issue and/or reach out to a lead for guidance.

sub_sections.title: Scanner Issues
sub_sections.content: On-site scanner issues are not immediately refundable. If the customer pays on-site, we can evaluate from there. If a customer simply leaves, this is typically non-refundable. Additionally, scanner issues should be escalated to Integrations (DSInt).

sub_sections.title: EV Refunds
sub_sections.content: Any requests for refund on EV charging sessions need to be escalated to EVC Escalations via Freshdesk for review and approval first.

sub_sections.title: Free parking
sub_sections.content: Sometimes, especially with events, customers will report that the attendant didn't scan their pass, said they didn't need to see it, etc. and therefore have the impression that parking is free or that payment wasn't required. In most cases, this is merely traffic control or poor training/wording on-site. We should NOT credit these - if anything, we should escalate to Seller Support or reach out to the POC directly for verification. If you have further questions, consult a Lead.

sub_sections.title: Validations - Malls or Restaurants and Other
sub_sections.content:
Some users might report that a validation or discount on their parking session did not go through. Generally, validations should not be done via the app - the customer should pay directly on-site to get the discount. However, if the customer has proof of their validation, we may be able to assist further.

If the validation is through a separate QR code (for example, one provided by a restaurant after the customer has already parked) the customer should be instructed to proceed with making the separate booking. If the customer has both on their account, we can proceed as a Confirmed Rebook. If they have provided a photo of the QR code they were provided, escalate to a Lead for next steps.

Another type may be a validation code that is set up by the seller on the Flash side. Since we do not have access to the Flash Portal, it’s best to escalate these to the location POC to confirm validity and for approval. If we do not hear back from the POC, we may be able to escalate these to Flash Support internally on a case by case basis - escalate to a Lead first.

8 In summary, if the customer has proof of their validation, escalate to a Lead to determine whether we can proceed immediately or if we should contact the POC first. If they have no proof of their validation, we cannot assist further and should direct them to the location instead.

© These are situations that you may encounter when working and speaking with customers. If you have a situation that is not mentioned in this guide, please reach out to the Lead of Duty for help on how to proceed. If there are any customer situations that you have come across that are not included here, please reach out to Alexandra or Michelle via Slack and let us know the details so that we can work on getting it added to the guide. Thank you for reading
